Subject: English
Description: VCE English and English as an Additional Language (EAL) focuses on how the English language is used to create meaning in print and digital texts of varying complexity.

Subject: English
Description: Texts selected for study are drawn from the past and present, from Australia and from other cultures, and comprise many text types, including media texts, for analysis of argument.

Subject: English
Description: The study is intended to meet the needs of students with a wide range of expectations and aspirations, including those for whom English is an additional language.

Subject: English
Description: extend their English language skills through reading, writing, speaking, listening, thinking and viewing to meet the demands of further study, the workplace, and their own needs and interests

Subject: English
Description: enhance their understanding, enjoyment and appreciation of the English language through all modes

Subject: English
Description: discuss, explore and analyse the form, purpose, context, text structures and language of texts from a range of styles and genres

Subject: English
Description: discuss, explore and analyse how culture, values and context underpin the construction of texts and how this can affect meaning and understanding

Subject: English
Description: convey ideas and demonstrate insight convincingly and confidently

Subject: English
Description: create print, digital and spoken texts

Subject: English
Description: demonstrate the ability to make informed choices about the construction of texts in relation to purpose, audience and context.

Subject: English
Description: Procedures for the assessment of levels of achievement in Units 1 and 2 are a matter for school decision. Assessment of levels of achievement for these units will not be reported to the VCAA. Schools may choose to report levels of achievement using grades, descriptive statements or other indicators.

Subject: English
Description: The VCAA specifies the assessment procedures for students undertaking scored assessment in Units 3 and 4. Designated assessment tasks are provided in the details for each unit in VCE study designs.

Subject: English
Description: The student’s level of achievement in Units 3 and 4 will be determined by School-assessed Coursework (SAC) as specified in the VCE study design, and external assessment.

Subject: English
Description:
The VCAA will report the student’s level of achievement on each assessment component as a grade from
A+ to E or UG (ungraded). To receive a study score the student must achieve two or more graded assessments in the study and receive an S for both Units 3 and 4. The study score is reported on a scale
of 0–50; it is a measure of how well the student performed in relation to all others who completed the study. Teachers should refer to the current VCE Administrative Handbook for details on graded assessment and calculation of the study score. Percentage contributions to the study score in VCE English and English as an Additional Language (EAL) are as follows:

Subject: English
Description: Details of the assessment program are described in the sections on Units 3 and 4 in this study design.
